column4: I can't write to the file "/proc/acpi/acer/wireless". Does anyone have any clue why?
the command looks weird with all those quotes...
echo "enabled: 1">/proc/acpi/acer/wireless
try ﻿echo "enabled: 1" > /proc/acpi/acer/wireless and you probably have to be root
notice in that forum post he did 'su' first
ah
I still get the same error
did you do the chmod 777 ?
without error
yes, that worked without error
I tried to edit the file with vim, but it wouldn't let me save
are you SURE you are root?
Yes, I'm root
wireless E667: Fsync failed
does the file contain anything? (cat /proc....)
it contains zero
try ﻿echo 1 > /proc/acpi/acer/wireless and you probably have to be root
worked
I thought so too, and tried to change it to "1" using vim, but still error, but now it worked, thanks ejer
i think you have to use echo
probably
However, it still didn't return anything with "dmesg | grep acer_acpi" which it should
